template.name: Template Futur-Tech App pfSense Active
template.description:
Active template for pfsense, requires pfsense_zbx.php installed to pfSense Box. Version 1.0.5
https://github.com/Futur-Tech/futur-tech-zabbix-pfsense

template.name: Template Futur-Tech Module Zabbix agent active
Template pfSense Active OpenVPN Server User Auth

item.name: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: Configured max number of opened files is too low

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: Configured max number of processes is too low

item.name: Expected CARP Status
item.description: Expected CARP Status

item.name: CARP Status
item.description: pfSense CARP Status

trigger.name: DHCP Failover Problems on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: One or more DHCP Pools are experiencing failover problems. This could potentially cause other problems in yourr network.

item.name: Certificates Manager: latest "validFrom"
item.description: This item will return will return the latest date "validFrom" from all the certificates (including CA). This is used to find new/renewed certificates.

trigger.name: One or more certificates have been renewed in the past 24h

item.name: Certificates Manager: earliest "validTo"
item.description: This item will return will return the earliest date "validTo" from all the certificates (including CA). This is used to find expiring certificates.

trigger.name: One or more certificates are expired
One or more certificates are expiring less than {$PFSENSE_CERT_EXPIRATION.AVERAGE}

dependency.name: One or more certificates are expired

trigger.name: One or more certificates are expiring less than {$PFSENSE_CERT_EXPIRATION.WARN}

dependency.name: One or more certificates are expired
One or more certificates are expiring less than {$PFSENSE_CERT_EXPIRATION.AVERAGE}

item.name: DHCP Failover Pool Problems
item.description: This value indicates, in a HA scenario, if DHCP failover pool partners are out of sync.

item.name: Gateway Status Raw
item.description: Gateway Status Raw

trigger.name: pfSense Gateway Status Changed
trigger.description: Gateway Status Change, for use with an acion Script (e.g. update DNS record)

item.name: SMART Status
item.description: pfSense SMART Status

trigger.name: SMART Errors
trigger.description: pfSense has detected SMART Problems on one or more drives.

trigger.name: New Version of pfSense Available
trigger.description: A new version of pfSense is available for update.

item.name: Packages Needing Update
item.description: Number of packages needing update.

trigger.name: Packages Update Available
trigger.description: New version of packages are available

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Processor load (1min/core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5min/core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15min/core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: Host name
item.description: System host name.

trigger.name: Lack of free swap space
trigger.description: It probably means that the systems requires more physical memory.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Active memory
item.description: Memory used by processes

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Buffered memory
item.description:
Cache d'entrées des IO disque.
(Item désactivé car buggé)

item.name: Cached memory
item.description: amount of memory used to cache data

item.name: Free memory
item.description: amount of memory completely free and ready to be used directly.

item.name: Inactive memory
item.description: amount of memory that contains data that is no longer used (can be directly freed if needed)

item.name: Available memory (percent)
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Shared memory
item.description:
quantité de mémoire partagée entre plusieurs processus
(Item désactivé car non utilisé)

item.name: Total memory
item.description: quantité de mémoire totale

item.name: Used memory
item.description: Item désactivé car non utilisé

item.name: Wired memory
item.description: amount of memory used by the kernel, can neither be unloaded in swap, nor compressed.

trigger_prototype.name: Gateway {#GATEWAY} is forced down
trigger_prototype.description: Gateway is forced down by system administrator

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

trigger_prototype.expression:
{Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[service_value,{#SERVICE},status].last()}=0 and {$PFSENSE_SRVC_MONITORING:"{#SERVICE}"}=1 and (
({Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[service_value,{#SERVICE},run_on_carp_slave].last()}=1 and {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=2)
or
( {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=1)
or
({Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=0) )
trigger_prototype.name: Service {#DESCRIPTION} is not running
trigger_prototype.description:
Service is not running
If you want to skip the trigger for this service, add the macro $PFSENSE_SRVC_MONITORING:"{#SERVICE}"=0
0 = Service monitoring disabled 1 = Service monitoring check if running 2 = Service monitoring check if not running

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[service_value,{#SERVICE},status].last()}=1 and {$PFSENSE_SRVC_MONITORING:"{#SERVICE}"}=2 and (({Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[service_value,{#SERVICE},run_on_carp_slave].last()}=1 and {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=2) or {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=1 or {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=0)
trigger_prototype.name: Service {#DESCRIPTION} is running
trigger_prototype.description:
Service is running
If you want to skip the trigger for this service, remove the macro $PFSENSE_SRVC_MONITORING:"{#SERVICE}"=2 Alternatively you can also set the macro to 1 or 0.
0 = Service monitoring disabled 1 = Service monitoring check if running 2 = Service monitoring check if not running

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free inodes is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

macro.description: Enable monitoring of Service pfBlockerNG DNSBL Web Server (check if NOT running)
Disable monitoring of Service iperf Network Performance Testing Daemon/Client
Enable monitoring of PC/SC Smart Card Daemon (check if NOT running) https://redmine.pfsense.org/issues/12095

trigger.name: CARP Status not Expected
trigger.description: pfSense CARP is not in the state Expected. This means that a failover could be in process.

trigger.name: New Version of pfSense {ITEM.LASTVALUE} Available
trigger.description: Notify of new version of pfsense available
